snippet: The federal three-judge panel in Denver deemed Oklahoma’s ban on same-sex marriage unconstitutional, after issuing a similar ruling concerning Utah in late June.
abstract: Federal appeals court rules that Oklahoma cannot deny gay couples their 'fundamental right' to wed; decision comes less than month after same panel of judges for United States Court of Appeals for 10th Circuit decided that similar ban in Utah was unconstitutional.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY and ADAM LIPTAK
byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from Denver, and Adam Liptak from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The federal three-judge panel in Denver deemed Oklahoma’s ban on same-sex marriage unconstitutional, after issuing a similar ruling concerning Utah in late June.

headline.main: Court Finds Oklahoma Cannot Ban Gay Nuptials
headline.print_headline: Court Finds Oklahoma Cannot Ban Gay Nuptials

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
